name: Classic Romances and Love Stories Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: In addition to his relationship with Bergman in "Casablanca", Bogart helps a young couple in need of money by allowing them to win while gambling at "Rick's". What game are they playing?
questions.explanation:
Roulette.

	This movie is on everyone's list of the best love stories from Hollywood (and is considered one of Hollywood's best films). Bogart, being sentimental, allows the the young man to win at roulette at "Rick's". Bergman didn't know it was going to be a classic. It is.

questions.text: "Gone With The Wind" is another tale of romance with a wartime background. Melanie reads a novel by Dickens to help Scarlett and other women await the return of Rhett and others from a "raid". Which novel?
questions.explanation:
David Copperfield.

	This is another one of Hollywood's most honored movies. Rhett and Scarlett - with the movie living up to the book. Everyone remembers the final line by Gable/Rhett.

questions.text: In "An Affair to Remember", Deborah Kerr fails to keep her appointment with Cary Grant when she's injured outside the Empire State Building. How did she get there?
questions.explanation:
Car.

	She gets out of the car a bit too quickly and carelessly. The ending of the movie provides something extra; the movie doesn't seem that special until the ending.

questions.text: In "West Side Story", Tony and Maria (a la Romeo and Juliet) have no problems with their relationship, but have tons of problems with their lives. Which of the following actors is NOT in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Edward Binns.

	Glass runs the soda shop where the Jets hang out. Astin is running the dance at the gym. Oakland plays the cynical cop.

questions.text: "Of Human Bondage" deals with infatuation and unrequited love; Leslie Howard is hung up on callous Bette Davis. What does the Davis character do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Waitress.

	It's a one-way street when Howard gets hung up on Davis ... who plays him for a fool before life catches up with her. Great role for Davis(and a great job by her) - but no Oscar this time.

questions.text: "Wuthering Heights" describes the romance between Merle Oberon and Laurence Olivier, but Oberon doesn't marry Olivier in the movie. Who does she marry?
questions.explanation:
David Niven.

	This is one of Hollywood's earliest "great romances". It is one of Olivier's best-known roles ...and nmay be THE best-known role for Oberon.

questions.text: What do the following love stories have in common: "A Place in the Sun", "The Postman Always Rings Twice", "Body Heat", and "Double Indemnity"?
questions.correct: All of the men are willing to consider murder as a solution to their problems
options: All of the men are blue collar workers
All of the women involved in the romances are married
All of the women involved in the romances go on to lead happy lives
questions.explanation:
All of the men are willing to consider murder as a solution to their problems.

	Clift in "Sun", MacMurray in "Indemnity", Garfield in "Postman" and Hurt in "Heat" all either perform a murder or contemplate one. Hurt is an attorney in the movie. Taylor is not married (in "Sun"). Stanwyck dies (in "Indemnity").

questions.text: What do "Laura" and "Vertigo" have in common?
questions.correct: The crime "victim" is not really dead
options: Both of the women in whom the protagonist is interested are married
Both of the women in whom the protagonist is interested are unmarried
Both women die at the end of the movie
questions.explanation:
The crime "victim" is not really dead.

	"Laura" isn't dead; her friend is. Kim Novak (in "Vertigo") isn't dead; it's a set-up. Novak's character is married, but "Laura" is not. "Laura" survives at the end.

questions.text: In which of these movies does Paul Newman "get the girl" at the end of the movie?
questions.explanation:
The Young Philadelphians.

	He parts company on good terms with Sally Field (in "Malice"); he parts company on not-so-good terms with Charlotte Rampling (in "Verdict"). Piper Laurie dies in "Hustler". In "Philadelphians", however, Newman is reunited with former girl friend Barbara Rush at the end of the movie.

questions.text: In which Bette Davis movie is her romance with her doctor ended by her blindness and death?
questions.explanation:
Dark Victory.

	All four are Davis vehicles, but it's "Victory" that has her relationship with George Brent ended by her death.
